text: Map of the Missouri River watershed The White River flowing into the Missouri River and coloring it with clay Tributaries of the Missouri River, a major river in the central United States, are listed in upstream order. These lists are arranged into river sections between cities or mouths of major tributaries for ease of navigation. Two large tributaries (the Platte and Yellowstone) have their own separate lists because they would be too lengthy to include in part of another section. Data is derived from U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) topographical maps and the USGS National Map. ==Mouth to Kansas City== *Gasconade River **Big Piney River ***Spring Creek **Roubidoux Creek **Osage
